title: Security Operations and Incident Response
description: Test your knowledge of security operations, incident handling, and response procedures. This quiz covers SOC operations, incident management, digital forensics, and threat hunting.

questions.text: What is a Security Operations Center (SOC)?

answers.text: A physical location where security professionals monitor and defend an organization's systems and data
A software tool for managing security incidents
A type of security certification
A security protocol for network communications

questions.text: What is the primary purpose of an incident response plan?

answers.text: To prevent all security incidents
To provide a structured approach for handling security incidents
To punish employees who cause security breaches
To eliminate the need for security monitoring

questions.text: What are the typical phases of an incident response process?

answers.text: Prevention, Detection, Response, Recovery
Preparation, Detection & Analysis, Containment, Eradication & Recovery, Post-Incident Activity
Identify, Protect, Detect, Respond, Recover
Plan, Do, Check, Act
The process of recovering and investigating material found in digital devices
The process of encrypting digital evidence
The process of developing secure digital systems
The process of backing up digital data

questions.text: What is the chain of custody in digital forensics?

answers.text: A security mechanism for protecting digital evidence
A chronological documentation showing the seizure, custody, control, transfer, and disposition of evidence
A method for encrypting forensic data
A technique for recovering deleted files

questions.text: What is a SIEM (Security Information and Event Management) system?

answers.text: A tool that provides real-time analysis of security alerts generated by applications and network hardware
A framework for developing security policies
A type of firewall
A method for encrypting sensitive data
The process of actively searching for threats that have evaded existing security solutions
The process of developing new security threats for testing
The process of categorizing known threats
The process of eliminating all security threats

questions.text: What is an indicator of compromise (IOC)?

answers.text: A sign that a system has been breached
A tool for preventing security breaches
A type of security certification
A method for securing compromised systems

questions.text: What is the purpose of a tabletop exercise in incident response?

answers.text: To physically secure computer equipment
To simulate a security incident to test and improve the incident response plan
To develop new security tools
To train employees on basic computer skills

questions.text: What is the difference between an IDS and an IPS?

answers.text: An IDS only detects suspicious activity, while an IPS can also prevent or block threats
An IDS is hardware-based, while an IPS is software-based
An IDS is for internal networks, while an IPS is for external networks
There is no difference; they are the same thing
